nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils

Class TransactionHelperImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils.TransactionHelperImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TransactionHelper

    public class TransactionHelperImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements TransactionHelper
    Utility class used to run code in a new transaction, taking care of running CurrentTransactionData#runCurrentTransactionCommitListeners() in case of commits, and always running CurrentTransactionData.cleanup() at the end
    Author:
    luis

      <T> T maybeRunInNewTransaction(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback, boolean newTransaction)
      Runs the given callback in a new transaction if the newTransaction flag is true and if the current LockedAccountsOnPayments is at least LockedAccountsOnPayments.ORIGIN

      • runAsync

        public <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> runAsync(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback)
        Description copied from interface: TransactionHelper
        Executes the given #TransactionCallback in a separate transaction, without waiting for the result. Propagates the current LoggedUser context to the new thread.
        Specified by:
        runAsync in interface TransactionHelper

      • runInCurrentThread

        public <T> T runInCurrentThread(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback)
        Description copied from interface: TransactionHelper
        Runs the current callback in the current thread. Doesn't touch the current LoggedUser context, but does ensure that CurrentTransactionData is processed (for example, commit / rollback listeners are notified) and cleared
        Specified by:
        runInCurrentThread in interface TransactionHelper

      • runInNewTransaction

        public <T> T runInNewTransaction(org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallback<T> callback)
        Description copied from interface: TransactionHelper
        Executes the given TransactionCallback in a separate transaction. A new thread is used to prevent the new and old transactions from clashing. Propagates the current LoggedUser context to the new thread.
        Specified by:
        runInNewTransaction in interface TransactionHelper
